summary:
I am a freelance consultant with over twenty years of professional experience in international development and social change. I have worked across various sectors and regions, including South-East Asia, the Pacific, Southern Africa, East Africa and West Africa. Over that time, I have worked for or been contracted by governments (Australia, UK, Switzerland), private companies, multilateral agencies (UN IFAD, ILO), inter-governmental organisations and NGOs. I've also taught postgraduate students as an adjunct faculty member of Lund University (2020-22). The recurrent theme? A steadfast commitment to improving the relevance and impact of what we do and how we do it.  

People and relationships are at the core of what I do, and that is why I typically act as a ‘critical friend’ to the teams and organisations with whom I work. At times this may mean acting as a reviewer or trusted sounding board. Sometimes it may mean acting as a bit of a pressure value – an extra pair of hands when backs are against the wall. And on other occasions, it’s simply to act as a day-to-day supporter, partner, coach or mentor to colleagues as they strategise, design, review or make sense of programs, partnerships and initiatives.
